page.title: 15Keeping Sheep at School
page.content: We keep sheep at{Andrews' Endowed {Primary School,}Holybourne. We have two black{Welsh Mountain {Sheep}ewes which we call{'Sooty'}and {'Sweep'}which live in paddocks at the back of our school. In the autumn, about the beginning of November, we borrow a ram from a local farm to{'tup'}Sooty and Sweep so that they can have lambs in the springtime. This year they each had twin ram lambs, which we will keep until we sell them to a farm in December. The money that we get from selling the lambs helps to pay for all the food and equipment that we have to buy each year for the sheep. Each summer all our sheep have to be{dipped}twice to help keep them healthy. We save the{fleeces}that we get when the sheep are shorn, so that we can learn to spin wool and weave.
